newsitem.title: USA: Imation to acquire Cemax-Icon for $30 mln.
newsitem.headline: Imation to acquire Cemax-Icon for $30 mln.

text.p: Imation Corp, the imaging and information products company spun off by Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Co last year, said Wednesday it agreed to acquire software developer Cemax-Icon Inc for $30 million.
In addition to the $30 million cash payment, Imation said it has agreed to pay an additional $49 million in cash or Imation stock over the next two years if certain milestones are met.
As part of the deal, Imation plans to write off about $40 million in costs for research and development that already is in progress, it said. The acquisition will be accounted for as a purchase.
Without this one-time expense, Imation does not expect the deal to have any material impact on its revenues, income and earnings per share in 1997, the company said.
But Cemax-Icon is expected to add to Imation's earnings in 1998 and beyond and to "contribute positively to the company's economic profit improvement," Imation said in a statement.

Fremont, Calif.-based Cemax-Icon develops visualization and picture archiving software and systems. The company, which has 135 employees, was formed by the merger of Cemax Inc and ICON Medical Systems in 1995.

"By leveraging Cemax-Icon's proven technology platforms and integrating them with our global sales and service capabilities, Imation is uniquely positioned to deliver a completely integrated digital solution that includes capturing, viewing, printing, managing and storing images and clinical information, said Bill Monahan, chairman and chief executive of Imation.
The deal is expected to close in the third quarter, Imation said. It is subject to state and federal regulatory approvals and Cemax-Icon shareholder approval.
"This proposed transaction will extend the successful business partnership our two organizations have enjoyed over the past three years," said Terry Ross, Cemax-Icon's chief executive.
